analytic.title: Prayer With Tears: A Great Feast of Repentance

biblStruct.note: "The purpose of this paper is mainly to examine briefly the relationship between Christian Prayer and Tears as expression of Repentance. This relationship presupposes the Incarnation of the Second Person of the Blessed Trinity and the Indwelling of the Holy Spirit - in other words the extension of the "KOINONIA" in the Triune God to the fallen human race, which christians usually all Salvation, Redemption, coming of the Kingdom or the eschatological Paradise." 2. Prayer. 3. Tears and prayer. 4. The tears of Jesus: Consequence of Kenosis. 5. On the Tears of Prayer. 6. The reference to tears, weeping moaning, etc. in the liturgical prayers of the Syrian Church. 7. Baptism of tears. (p. 111)
